means: 耕作，犁地( till的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Workers were singing as they tilled the rice paddy fields.
sentence.Network_cn: 劳动者们一边耕犁稻田一边唱歌。

sentence.Network_en: His family has tilled these fields for four generations.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的家族更是在这片土地上耕作了整整四代.

sentence.Network_en: A panorama of carefully tilled farmlands unfolds before the visitor's eyes.
sentence.Network_cn: 一幅悉心耕作的农场美景展现在来访者眼前.

PerfectNetExp.abs: a paper from 1942 reports a woman falling 28metres from her apartment building into freshly tilled soil . she walked away with just a fractured rib and broken wrist .一份1942年的报道说，一个妇女从她28米的公寓摔了下来，可幸运的是她落在一片刚犁过的土上，只是断了根肋骨、扭了一下腰。
tillborg 蒂尔堡, tilled 耕种的, tille 蒂勒
Not tilled or cultivated., 未被耕种或开垦的.

用适当介词填空_百度知道 ... have a hard time with 有困难 till now 直到现在，完成时态的标志 at school 固定搭配哟.
急求外研版高中英语必修一单词表_百度知道 ... so far 到目前为止 up to now 到目前为止 till now 到目前为止.

ablation moraine 消融碛ablation till 消融碛-

entry.tran: (常于口语与非正式书面语中代替 until)
entry.def: In spoken English and informal written English, till is often used instead of until .

example.ex: They had to wait till Monday to ring the bank manager...
example.tran: 他们必须等到周一才能给银行经理打电话。

example.ex: I've survived till now, and will go on doing so without help from you.
example.tran: 我一直努力活到了现在，而且没有你的帮助也能继续活下去。

entry.tran: (商店等处的)现金出纳机，收银机
entry.def: In a shop or other place of business, a till is a counter or cash register where money is kept, and where customers pay for what they have bought.

example.ex: ...long queues at tills that make customers angry.
example.tran: 收银台前令顾客恼火的长队

entry.tran: (收银机中的)钱柜，放钱的抽屉
entry.def: A till is the drawer of a cash register, in which the money is kept.

example.ex: He checked the register. There was money in the till.
example.tran: 他查看了一下收银机的抽屉，里面有钱。

entry.def: When people till land, they prepare the earth and work on it in order to grow crops.

example.ex: Workers were singing as they tilled the rice paddy fields.
example.tran: 劳动者们一边耕犁稻田一边唱歌。

means.word_mean: 1. turned or stirred by plowing or harrowing or hoeing;

auth_sentence.content: No-tilled soil results in greater water infiltration, less runoff, less erosion, and reduced flooding.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: No-tilled soil results in greater water infiltration, less runoff, less erosion, and reduced flooding.
